trans-unit.source: Configure automatic device registration for Windows 7 domain joined devices| Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Configure automatic device registration for Windows 7 domain joined devices| Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Steps to configure your Windows 7 domain joined devices to automatically register with Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: Steps to configure your Windows 7 domain joined devices to automatically register with Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: and steps to deploy the device registration software package to your Windows 7 domain joined devices using a software distribution system such as System Center Configuration Manager.
trans-unit.target: and steps to deploy the device registration software package to your Windows 7 domain joined devices using a software distribution system such as System Center Configuration Manager.

trans-unit.source: Configure automatic device registration for Windows 7 domain joined devices
trans-unit.target: Configure automatic device registration for Windows 7 domain joined devices

trans-unit.source: As an IT admin, you can configure your Windows 7 domain joined devices to automatically register with Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: As an IT admin, you can configure your Windows 7 domain joined devices to automatically register with Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: To do so, you must deploy the device registration software package to your Windows 7 domain joined devices using a software distribution system such as System Center Configuration Manager.
trans-unit.target: To do so, you must deploy the device registration software package to your Windows 7 domain joined devices using a software distribution system such as System Center Configuration Manager.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to read through and complete the prerequisites listed in Automatic Device Registration with Azure Active Directory for Windows Domain-Joined Devices.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to read through and complete the prerequisites listed in Automatic Device Registration with Azure Active Directory for Windows Domain-Joined Devices.

trans-unit.source: Installing the device registration software package on Windows 7 domain joined devices
trans-unit.target: Installing the device registration software package on Windows 7 domain joined devices

trans-unit.source: Device registration for Windows 7 is available as a downloadable MSI package.
trans-unit.target: Device registration for Windows 7 is available as a downloadable MSI package.

trans-unit.source: The package must be installed on Windows 7 machines that are joined to an Active Directory Domain.
trans-unit.target: The package must be installed on Windows 7 machines that are joined to an Active Directory Domain.

trans-unit.source: You should deploy the package using a software distribution system such as System Center Configuration Manager.
trans-unit.target: You should deploy the package using a software distribution system such as System Center Configuration Manager.

trans-unit.source: The MSI package supports the standard silent install options using the /quiet parameter.
trans-unit.target: The MSI package supports the standard silent install options using the /quiet parameter.

trans-unit.source: The software package is available for download at the Microsoft Connect website.
trans-unit.target: The software package is available for download at the Microsoft Connect website.

trans-unit.source: Here you can select and then download Workplace Join for Windows 7.
trans-unit.target: Here you can select and then download Workplace Join for Windows 7.

trans-unit.source: Workplace Join with Azure Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Workplace Join with Azure Active Directory

trans-unit.source: Device registration for Windows 7 domain joined devices does not require or include a user interface.
trans-unit.target: Device registration for Windows 7 domain joined devices does not require or include a user interface.

trans-unit.source: Once installed on the machine, any domain user that logs into the machine will be automatically and silently registered with a device object in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: Once installed on the machine, any domain user that logs into the machine will be automatically and silently registered with a device object in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: There will be one device object in Azure AD for every registered user of the physical device.
trans-unit.target: There will be one device object in Azure AD for every registered user of the physical device.

trans-unit.source: The installer creates a Scheduled Task on the system that runs in the user’s context and is triggered on user sign-in.
trans-unit.target: The installer creates a Scheduled Task on the system that runs in the user’s context and is triggered on user sign-in.

trans-unit.source: The task silently registers the user and device with Azure AD after the user signs-in is complete.
trans-unit.target: The task silently registers the user and device with Azure AD after the user signs-in is complete.

trans-unit.source: The Scheduled Task can be found in the Task Scheduler Library under **Microsoft** > **Workplace Join**.
trans-unit.target: The Scheduled Task can be found in the Task Scheduler Library under **Microsoft** > **Workplace Join**.

trans-unit.source: The task will run and register any and all Active Directory users that sign-in to the machine.
trans-unit.target: The task will run and register any and all Active Directory users that sign-in to the machine.

trans-unit.source: The following illustration lists the step-by-step process for automatic device registration.
trans-unit.target: The following illustration lists the step-by-step process for automatic device registration.

trans-unit.source: A user (information worker) logs on to a Windows 7 client computer using Active Directory domain credentials.
trans-unit.target: A user (information worker) logs on to a Windows 7 client computer using Active Directory domain credentials.

trans-unit.source: The Workplace Join scheduled task is executed.
trans-unit.target: The Workplace Join scheduled task is executed.

trans-unit.source: The user is silently authenticated with AD FS using Windows Integrated Authentication.
trans-unit.target: The user is silently authenticated with AD FS using Windows Integrated Authentication.

trans-unit.source: The Windows 7 PC is registered to the user in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: The Windows 7 PC is registered to the user in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: A device object and certificate is created in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: A device object and certificate is created in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: The object represents the user@device.
trans-unit.target: The object represents the user@device.

trans-unit.source: The Workplace Join certificate is stored on the machine.
trans-unit.target: The Workplace Join certificate is stored on the machine.

trans-unit.source: Unregistering your Windows 7 domain joined devices
trans-unit.target: Unregistering your Windows 7 domain joined devices

trans-unit.source: You may choose unregister your domain joined Windows 7 devices by doing the following:
trans-unit.target: You may choose unregister your domain joined Windows 7 devices by doing the following:

trans-unit.source: Uninstall the Workplace Join software package from your Windows 7 domain joined devices using a software distribution system such as System Center Configuration Manager.
trans-unit.target: Uninstall the Workplace Join software package from your Windows 7 domain joined devices using a software distribution system such as System Center Configuration Manager.

trans-unit.source: Then, open a command prompt on the Windows 7 machine and execute the following command to unregister the device:
trans-unit.target: Then, open a command prompt on the Windows 7 machine and execute the following command to unregister the device:

trans-unit.source: This command must be run in the context of each domain user that has signed into the machine.
trans-unit.target: This command must be run in the context of each domain user that has signed into the machine.

trans-unit.source: Event Viewer and Errors for Windows 7 domain joined devices.
trans-unit.target: Event Viewer and Errors for Windows 7 domain joined devices.

trans-unit.source: The Windows Event Log on the Windows 7 machine will display messages related to Workplace Join.
trans-unit.target: The Windows Event Log on the Windows 7 machine will display messages related to Workplace Join.

trans-unit.source: You can find messages for both successful and unsuccessful Workplace Join events.
trans-unit.target: You can find messages for both successful and unsuccessful Workplace Join events.

trans-unit.source: The Event Log can be found in the Event Viewer under Applications and Services Logs> Microsoft-Workplace Join.
trans-unit.target: The Event Log can be found in the Event Viewer under Applications and Services Logs> Microsoft-Workplace Join.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
